com.kuka.io

Interface IIoValueProvider


  • public interface IIoValueProvider
    Provider to access the values of IOs.

    Offers functionality to both read and write IO values.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCanSetValueListener(ICanSetValueListener listener)
      Adds a listener that gets notified when the modifiability of IOs changes (see canSetValue(IIoDefinition).
      boolean canSetValue(IIoDefinition ioDefinition)
      Indicates whether it is possible to modify the value of the specified IO at the time of this method call.
      IIoValue getIoValue(IIoDefinition ioDefinition)
      Gets the value of the IO with the specified definition.
      Collection<IIoValue> getIoValues(Collection<IIoDefinition> ioDefinitions)
      Gets the values of the IOs in the specified collection of IO definitions.
      void removeCanSetValueListener(ICanSetValueListener listener)
      Removed the specified listener so that it no longer gets notified when the modifiability of IOs changes.
      void setValue(IIoDefinition ioDefinition, boolean value)
      Sets the value of the specified IO.
      void setValue(IIoDefinition ioDefinition, Number value)
      Sets the value of the specified IO.

    • Method Detail

      • getIoValue

        IIoValue getIoValue(IIoDefinition ioDefinition)
        Gets the value of the IO with the specified definition.
        Parameters:
        ioDefinition - the definition of the IO to get the value of
        Returns:
        the value of the IO
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the IO with the specified definition could not be found on the controller

      • getIoValues

        Collection<IIoValue> getIoValues(Collection<IIoDefinition> ioDefinitions)
        Gets the values of the IOs in the specified collection of IO definitions.

        The values of the IOs are read at the same point in time.

        Parameters:
        ioDefinitions - the collection of IO definitions to get the values of
        Returns:
        the list of IO values

      • canSetValue

        boolean canSetValue(IIoDefinition ioDefinition)
        Indicates whether it is possible to modify the value of the specified IO at the time of this method call.

        If the configuration feature 'Disable I/O access during emergency stop' is activated (true) it is not possible to modify output values if an emergency stop (internal or external) is active or the operator safety is violated. The setter methods setValue(IIoDefinition, Number) and setValue(IIoDefinition, boolean) will throw an exception in these cases.

        Note: The result of this method is not a guarantee whether the setter methods will not throw an exception. If the emergency stop or operator safety status changes in the meantime, the return value of this method may be out-dated.

        Parameters:
        ioDefinition - the definition of the IO for which the modifiability should be checked
        Returns:
        true, if it is possible to modify the value of the specified IO at the time of this method call

      • addCanSetValueListener

        void addCanSetValueListener(ICanSetValueListener listener)
        Adds a listener that gets notified when the modifiability of IOs changes (see canSetValue(IIoDefinition).
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to add

      • removeCanSetValueListener

        void removeCanSetValueListener(ICanSetValueListener listener)
        Removed the specified listener so that it no longer gets notified when the modifiability of IOs changes.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to remove

      • setValue

        void setValue(IIoDefinition ioDefinition,
              Number value)
        Sets the value of the specified IO.

        Note: If the configuration feature 'Disable I/O access during emergency stop' is activated (true) it is not possible to set output values if an emergency stop (internal or external) is active or the operator safety is violated. An IllegalStateException is thrown in these cases.

        Parameters:
        ioDefinition - the definition of the IO to set the value of
        value - the value to set
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the value is not valid for the IO
        IllegalStateException - if the configuration feature 'Disable I/O access during emergency stop' is activated and an emergency stop (internal or external) is active or the operator safety is violated
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the IO is not an output

      • setValue

        void setValue(IIoDefinition ioDefinition,
              boolean value)
        Sets the value of the specified IO.

        Note: If the configuration feature 'Disable I/O access during emergency stop' is activated (true) it is not possible to set output values if an emergency stop (internal or external) is active or the operator safety is violated. An IllegalStateException is thrown in these cases.

        Parameters:
        ioDefinition - the definition of the IO to set the value of
        value - the value to set
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the value is not valid for the IO
        IllegalStateException - if the configuration feature 'Disable I/O access during emergency stop' is activated and an emergency stop (internal or external) is active or the operator safety is violated
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the IO is not an output
